page.title: 19Farming in our Area.
page.content: {FARMING IN AND AROUND MARKYATE Most of the land in and around Markyate is farming land. Here is some information about what is generally grown on these farms.The soil is clay with flint overlaying chalk and is a good soil for wheat.One of the main soil types is Winchester.It is full of clay and very difficult to cultivate. It has high natural fertility. This soil holds its moisture during a drought and will also retain nitrates from one year to the next.Some farmhouses are between four and five hundred years old and were originally built of lathe and plaster, but the outside walls have been replaced with bricks one hundred and fifty years ago.This is certainly true for Roe End Farm.In 1944 they had 135 acres of wheat in 1984 this was 370 acres.The yield per acre also increased from
